depressed anterior table frontal sinus f.context: 1. Depressed anterior table frontal sinus fracture on the right side.

orbital blowout fracture.context: 3. Right orbital blowout fracture with entrapped periorbita.

nasal septal and nasal pyramid fracture.context: 4. Nasal septal and nasal pyramid fracture with nasal airway obstruction.

open reduction and internal plate and sc.context: 1. Open reduction and internal plate and screw fixation of depressed anterior table right frontal sinus.

transconjunctival exploration.context: 2. Transconjunctival exploration of right orbital floor with release of entrapped periorbita.

open reduction of nasal septum and nasal.context: 3. Open reduction of nasal septum and nasal pyramid fracture with osteotomy.

gull-wing incision.context: A gull-wing incision was drawn over the forehead scalp.

inferiorly based forehead flap.context: An inferiorly based forehead flap was then elevated to the superior orbital rim.

mucocele.context: A mucocele was removed from the frontal sinus and there was no significant destruction of the posterior wall.

osteotomies.context: At this point, the nose was significantly shifted to the left and an open reduction of the nasal fracture was performed by osteotomies, which were made medially, laterally, and percutaneous transverse osteotomy of the nasal bone on the right side.

local infiltration anesthesia.context: Local infiltration anesthesia 1% Xylocaine with 1:100,000 epinephrine was infiltrated in the conjunctival fornix of the right lower eyelid as well as the inferior orbital rim.

preseptal approach.context: An incision was made in the palpebral conjunctiva and capsular palpebral fascia beneath the tarsal plate preseptal approach to the inferior orbital rim was performed in this fashion.

entrapped periorbita.context: There was entrapped periorbita, which was released to the fractures, which were repositioned, but not fixed in position.

Boies elevator.context: The nasal pyramid was satisfactorily mobilized as well as the nasal septum and brought back to midline position with the help of a Boies elevator for the septum.

Mastisol Orthoplast splint.context: Mastisol Orthoplast splint was prepared after the Doyle splints were placed in the nose and secured with 3-0 Prolene suture and the nose packed with two Kennedy Merocel sponges.
